introduction: In this video, the speaker discusses the importance of choosing the right database for a growing business. They highlight key considerations such as the existing database's limitations, the need for a different database, and the importance of benchmarking and testing before migration. They also touch on the trade-offs involved in different database types and the importance of understanding the architecture and limitations of the database.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding the Current Database
content: Examining the existing database's architecture and limitations.
Identifying performance issues such as high latency or working set overflow.
Exploring potential fixes to the application architecture, such as adding caching or sharding.
Considering the need for read replicas to offload read load.

sections.title: Section 2: Choosing the Right Database
content: Exploring different database types and their trade-offs.
Considering the industry-specific requirements for database selection.
Evaluating the database's design constraints and limitations.
Reading the database manual and understanding the real limits.

sections.title: Section 3: Benchmarking and Testing
content: Importance of benchmarking and testing before migrating to a new database.
Measuring p99 of everything and trying to replicate real workload.
Testing risky operational tasks like failing over a node or data corruption during network partitions.
Paying attention to outliers and considering up or downsharding if applicable.

sections.title: Section 4: Migration Planning
content: Writing a detailed step-by-step migration plan.
Reviewing the plan thoroughly with peers.
Migrating a small service first and learning from the experience.
Carefully planning the migration to minimize risks and potential downtime.

sections.title: Section 5: Database Selection Best Practices
content: Preferring established and battle-tested databases.
Understanding the trade-offs involved in different database types.
Joining chat rooms and asking questions to learn more about a particular database.
Reading GitHub issues and learning as much as possible about the candidate.
